--- title: "Lecture [06a] Activity" --- ![](../../img/programmer_2780E3.svg){.hero} ## Question 1 (Code Style) Apply the tidyverse style guide principles to clean up the following code: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) df <- mpg |> filter(year==2008) |> select(manufacturer , model, class, displ, hwy ) |> mutate (manufacturer=str_to_title(manufacturer), model = str_to_title ( model ),class = str_to_title(class)) ggplot(data = df, mapping = aes(x = hwy, y = class, fill = class)) + geom_vline(xintercept=25, color = "grey40", linewidth = 1) + geom_violin(color = "black",linewidth = 2 / 3,draw_quantiles = c(0.25,0.50, 0.75),scale = "count" ) ``` :::

Click here for the answer key
*If you didn't enjoy this question, imagine what grading in this course is like and let that motivate you to style your code nicely when submitting assignments in the future!* ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) mpg2008 <- mpg |> filter(year == 2008) |> select(manufacturer, model, class, displ, hwy) |> mutate( manufacturer = str_to_title(manufacturer), model = str_to_title(model), class = str_to_title(class) ) ggplot(mpg2008, aes(x = hwy, y = class, fill = class)) + geom_vline(xintercept = 25, color = "grey40", linewidth = 1) + geom_violin( color = "black", linewidth = 2 / 3, draw_quantiles = c(0.25, 0.50, 0.75), scale = "count" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06a_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=480} ::: :::

Click here for the answer key
**Part (a)** Add `#| message: false` to the top of the chunk **Part (b)** Add `#| fig-height: 5` and `#| fig-width: 5` to the top of the chunk
